protocol_name: High quality DNA extraction protocol from recalcitrant plant tissues
protocol_name_html: High quality DNA extraction protocol from recalcitrant plant tissues
description:
This protocol was developed in order to remove secondary compounds which inhibited restriction enzyme digestion of Xanthorrhoea genomic DNA. It has also been used to successfully obtain high quality, high weight DNA from other recalcitrant plant tissues, including Eucalyptus, Eremophila, Spyridium, and various Malvaceae, Rutaceae, Orchidaceae, and Fabaceae species.

 

It is based on a modified CTAB protocol from Doyle and Doyle (1990), and includes modifications from Shepherd and McLay (2011) and Tibbits et al (2006).
before_start:
Prepare the following reagents:

 

Tris-HCl pH8 (1M)

EDTA (0.5M)

NaCl (5M)

STE

CTAB 

NaCl:BSA 5:1

Sodium acetate (2.4M)

Tris-HCl pH8 (10mM)

70% ethanol
warning: General chloroform extraction safety. The inclusion of BME makes a fumehood a requirement.

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

guidelines:
This protocol requires standard molecular laboratory equipment and chemicals. There are three solution additives which were critical for removing inhibiting secondary compounds from Xanthorrhoea tissue; STE, NaCl:BSA, and NaAC. It is possible that not all these additives are required for all plant tissues. However, all three are used in our lab to obtain very clean DNA from a variety of families. 

 

It is possible to include the NaAC wash step with the isopropanol precipitation, but performing it at the end seems to produce better quality DNA.

4g sucrose 2g sucrose
1.5 mL Tris-HCl pH8 (1M)

 0.75 mL Tris-HCl pH8 (1M)
 5 mL EDTA (0.5M) 2.5 mL EDTA (0.5M)
H2O to 50 mL  H2O to 25 mL

components.data: Prepare STE (fresh is best, keep for 2 weeks maximum)
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare CTAB (fresh is better)
components.name: Section

components.data:
Make 100x (=4%) BSA from powder in H2O. Combine 5M NaCl with 100x BSA in a 5:1 ratio.

 

This can be frozen for long-term storage.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Make 100x (=4%) BSA from powder in H2O. Combine 5M NaCl with 100x BSA in a 5:1 ratio.

 

This can be frozen for long-term storage.

components.data: Prepare NaCl:BSA additive
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 600 mL of CTAB per sample to a falcon tube. In fumehood, add 2 μL of BME per mL of CTAB, and 4 μL of Proteinase K per reaction. Warm at 65 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 600 mL of CTAB per sample to a falcon tube. In fumehood, add 2 μL of BME per mL of CTAB, and 4 μL of Proteinase K per reaction. Warm at 65 °C.

components.data: Preheat CTAB
components.name: Section

components.data:
Grind 20-50 mg of plant tissue using your favourite grinding method. I use liquid nitrogen and grinding sand for particularly sclerophyllous tissue. Place into labelled 1.7 mL eppendorf tube. 

 

At this stage it is useful to label two additional tubes per sample. You could either label them now or later during a centrifugation step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Grind 20-50 mg of plant tissue using your favourite grinding method. I use liquid nitrogen and grinding sand for particularly sclerophyllous tissue. Place into labelled 1.7 mL eppendorf tube. 

 

At this stage it is useful to label two additional tubes per sample. You could either label them now or later during a centrifugation step.

components.data: Grind tissue
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 1 mL of STE to tissue. Vortex thoroughly so tissue is fully mixed. Spin at 5000 rpm for 10 minutes. Discard supernatent by pouring off.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 mL of STE to tissue. Vortex thoroughly so tissue is fully mixed. Spin at 5000 rpm for 10 minutes. Discard supernatent by pouring off.

components.data: STE step
components.name: Section

components.data: In a fumehood, add 500 μL of the pre-warmed CTAB solution to each tube. Add 100 uL of NaCl:BSA solution. Vortex. Incubate at 65 C for at least an hour (to overnight). Mix by vortexing or shaking several times through incubation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In a fumehood, add 500 μL of the pre-warmed CTAB solution to each tube. Add 100 uL of NaCl:BSA solution. Vortex. Incubate at 65 C for at least an hour (to overnight). Mix by vortexing or shaking several times through incubation.

components.data: Addition of CTAB
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 450 μL of chloroform to each tube. *If this volume of chloroform will not fit into the eppendorf tube, split the tissue+CTAB mixture into two separate eppendorf tubes and add 450 μL of chloroform to each tube.

 

Shake to mix and open tube to release built-up gas using a kimwipe to catch drops. Be careful of cross-contamination at this point. 

 

Spin at maximum speed for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 450 μL of chloroform to each tube. *If this volume of chloroform will not fit into the eppendorf tube, split the tissue+CTAB mixture into two separate eppendorf tubes and add 450 μL of chloroform to each tube.

 

Shake to mix and open tube to release built-up gas using a kimwipe to catch drops. Be careful of cross-contamination at this point. 

 

Spin at maximum speed for 5 minutes.

components.data: First chloroform step
components.name: Section

components.data: using a P200 set to 190 μL, remove the top aqueous phase (usually between 300-400 μL) and put into a new eppendorf tube. Be careful not to include any of the solid layer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: using a P200 set to 190 μL, remove the top aqueous phase (usually between 300-400 μL) and put into a new eppendorf tube. Be careful not to include any of the solid layer.

components.data: removing supernatent
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 450 μL to the removed aqueous phase solution. Shake to mix and open tube to release built-up gas using a kimwipe to catch drops.

 

Spin at maximum speed for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 450 μL to the removed aqueous phase solution. Shake to mix and open tube to release built-up gas using a kimwipe to catch drops.

 

Spin at maximum speed for 5 minutes.

components.data: Second chloroform step
components.name: Section

components.data: Using a P200 set to 190 μL, remove the top aqueous phase (usually between 300-400 μL) and put into a new eppendorf tube. Be even more vigilant at this step as there is no solid barrier separating the top aqueous phase from the chloroform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a P200 set to 190 μL, remove the top aqueous phase (usually between 300-400 μL) and put into a new eppendorf tube. Be even more vigilant at this step as there is no solid barrier separating the top aqueous phase from the chloroform.

components.data: Removing supernatant
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 500 uL of room temperature isopropanol. Mix by gently inverting five times.

 

*At this step it is possible to add 110 μL sodium acetate (3M, pH5.2), 500 μL isopropanol, and mix by gently inverting with a 20 mins incubation at room temp. Then follow Steps 13-16. This avoids the need to precipitate again with NaAC after re-eluting the DNA (Steps 17-20) . However, this step did not work with some taxa and resulted in loss of DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 500 uL of room temperature isopropanol. Mix by gently inverting five times.

 

*At this step it is possible to add 110 μL sodium acetate (3M, pH5.2), 500 μL isopropanol, and mix by gently inverting with a 20 mins incubation at room temp. Then follow Steps 13-16. This avoids the need to precipitate again with NaAC after re-eluting the DNA (Steps 17-20) . However, this step did not work with some taxa and resulted in loss of DNA.

components.data: Isopropanol DNA precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Spin for 10 minutes at maximum speed with eppendorf tubes facing inwards (i.e. the hinge is to the outside of the centre of the centrifuge). 

 

A DNA pellet may appear at the bottom of the tube. 

 

 

Carefully pour off the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Spin for 10 minutes at maximum speed with eppendorf tubes facing inwards (i.e. the hinge is to the outside of the centre of the centrifuge). 

 

A DNA pellet may appear at the bottom of the tube. 

 

 

Carefully pour off the supernatant.

components.data: Isopropanol centrifugation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 500 μL of 70% ethanol (made fresh). Try to dislodge the pellet from the bottom of the tube through pipetting or flicking the tube. 

 

Centrifuge for five minutes at maximum speed. 

 

Carefully pour off the ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 500 μL of 70% ethanol (made fresh). Try to dislodge the pellet from the bottom of the tube through pipetting or flicking the tube. 

 

Centrifuge for five minutes at maximum speed. 

 

Carefully pour off the ethanol.

components.data: Ethanol wash and centrifugation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Dry pellets for at least two hours to overnight by leaving tubes open on bench/in fumehood, with kimwipes securely placed over them. 

 

Alternatively, you can wick the remaining ethanol away using kimwipes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dry pellets for at least two hours to overnight by leaving tubes open on bench/in fumehood, with kimwipes securely placed over them. 

 

Alternatively, you can wick the remaining ethanol away using kimwipes.

components.data: Drying pellet
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 50 μL of 10mM Tris-HCl pH8 and allow DNA to resuspend for at least one hour before use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 μL of 10mM Tris-HCl pH8 and allow DNA to resuspend for at least one hour before use.

components.data: Resuspension in Tris-HCl 10mM
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 200 μL of 100% ethanol and 36.25 μL of NaAC (2.4M) to each tube. 

 

Mix by inverting.

 

Centrifuge at maximum speed for 10 minutes.

 

 *this step can be incorporated into the isopropanol step by including NaAC so the final concentration is 0.3M, although this did not seem to work for Xanthorrhoea.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 200 μL of 100% ethanol and 36.25 μL of NaAC (2.4M) to each tube. 

 

Mix by inverting.

 

Centrifuge at maximum speed for 10 minutes.

 

 *this step can be incorporated into the isopropanol step by including NaAC so the final concentration is 0.3M, although this did not seem to work for Xanthorrhoea.

components.data: Sodium acetate wash
components.name: Section

components.data:
Carefully pour off supernatant. Occassionally the pellet is not stuck to the tube so careful it doesn't come out.

 

Add 1000 μL of 70% ethanol. Try to dislodge the pellet from the bottom of the tube through pipetting or flicking the tube. 

 

Centrifuge at maximum speed for three minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Carefully pour off supernatant. Occassionally the pellet is not stuck to the tube so careful it doesn't come out.

 

Add 1000 μL of 70% ethanol. Try to dislodge the pellet from the bottom of the tube through pipetting or flicking the tube. 

 

Centrifuge at maximum speed for three minutes.

components.data: Ethanol wash
components.name: Section

components.data:
Carefully pour off supernatant. 

 

Dry pellets for at least two hours to overnight by leaving tubes open on bench/in fumehood, with kimwipes securely placed over them.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Carefully pour off supernatant. 

 

Dry pellets for at least two hours to overnight by leaving tubes open on bench/in fumehood, with kimwipes securely placed over them.

components.data: Drying pellet
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 50-100 μL of 10mM Tris-HCl pH8 and allow DNA to resuspend for at least one hour before use. 

 

Check quality and quantity using spectrophotometry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Check quality and quantity using spectrophotometry.

components.data: Resuspension of pellet.
components.name: Section
